meanings.definition: A person who is excessively critical or judgmental.
meanings.sent1: The hypercritic always finds something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a hypercritic because she never had anything nice to say.
meanings.sent3: The hypercritic at the party kept pointing out flaws in the decorations.
meanings.sent4: Her inner hypercritic never seemed to take a break, always nitpicking every detail.
meanings.sent5: The hypercritic's sharp tongue could cut through even the thickest skin.

meanings.definition: To criticize or judge someone or something excessively.
meanings.sent1: He tends to hypercritic everything his friends do.
meanings.sent2: Don't hypercriticize every little mistake, learn to let things go.
meanings.sent3: She would hypercritic the weather forecast, even though she couldn't control it.
meanings.sent4: The coach would hypercritic the players' performance, pushing them to improve.
meanings.sent5: Try not to hypercritic too much, it can be exhausting for both you and others.
